feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [BHS1][Dedicated Servers] - Racks 80A10 - 80A11 - 80A12 - 80A04
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 25, 04:00 - 11:00 UTC

May 14, 22:17 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Baremetal offer.

Start time : 25/06/2024 04:00 UTC
End time : 25/06/2024 11:00 UTC
Service impact : Each server in racks 80A10 - 80A11 - 80A12 - 80A04 will be unreachable during the maintenance
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we will be moving servers in racks 80A10 - 80A11 - 80A12 - 80A04

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API call removal
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT May 30, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 2, 15:37 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API.

The 30th of May 2024, the following API call will be definitely removed:
GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/templateCapabilities

Start time : 30/05/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 30/05/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : This API call was previously useful for old Windows OS installers that were not compatible with installation on another diskgroup on servers with multiple diskgroups. Since then all OSes can be installed on any diskgroup.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [ERI1/LIM1/LIM3/SBG3/SBG5/SGP1/SYD1/WAW1][Dedicated Servers] - Boot Firmware Maintenance
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT May 20, 09:00 - 10:00 UTC

May 14, 20:11 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our infrastructure.

Start time : 20/05/2024 09:00 UTC
End time : 20/05/2024 10:00 UTC
Service impact : This maintenance may affect reboots to disk or in rescue mode for servers running very old hardware
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our servers, we will be changing the boot firmware of legacy boot servers in ERI1/LIM1/LIM3/SBG3/SBG5/SGP1/SYD1/WAW1 from SYSLINUX to iPXE.


Thank you for your understanding.

entry.content:
May 15, 10:08 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 15/05/2024 08:38 UTC
End time : 15/05/2024 09:37 UTC
Root cause : Incident due to a issue on our cooling system.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

May 15, 09:27 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 15/05/2024 08:38 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in the rack 07A01 and 07A03 are unreachable.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Dedicated Servers] - Windows OS language API change
entry.content:
May 14, 20:02 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

May 14, 08:30 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

May 14, 08:30 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer.

Start time : 14/05/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 14/05/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : No impact expected.
Customers not installing any Windows OSes from API and/or installing Windows OSes from OVHcloud control panel are not affected by this change.
Customers using that API call for installing any windows OSes in a display language other English are affected by this change and need to update their scripts and applications accordingly.
Service improvement : The following API call with details/language attribute within the payload will definitely stop working: POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/start

Below you can find an example of payload that will stop working for a win2022-dc OS installation:
```json
{
"details": {
"language": "fr",
},
"templateName": "win2022-dc_64"
}
```

With the previous example, here is the target payload that customer can already use and that will continue to work:
```json
{
"userMetadata": [
{
"key": "language",
"value": "fr-fr"
}
],
"templateName": "win2022-dc_64"
}
```

More details and examples can be found in the Documentation Page

Thank you for your understanding.
